alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 9:18AM EST until January 14 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River At Matoaca affecting Dinwiddie, City of Petersburg and Chesterfield Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville, Mattoax, Matoaca... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River at Matoaca. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Canal begins to overflow along the right bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EST Saturday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 9.4 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 11/16/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.this evening at 930 PM EST.
